description: System-generated unique identifier for each record as stored on the NYC Open Data (Socrata) platform.
Internal version number for the row on the NYC Open Data platform, used to track updates to individual records.
Timestamp indicating when the record was first created in the NYC Open Data system.
Timestamp indicating the most recent update to the record in the NYC Open Data system.
Official name of the NYCHA housing development associated with the account.
NYC borough where the development is located.
expected_values / examples: Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, Staten Island

description: Name or label of the utility billing account as defined by the vendor or NYCHA.
Building number within the development; used with TDS and building number to uniquely identify each building.
Indicator of the meter type: Automatic Meter Reading, interval meter, or non-AMR meter.
Description of the buildings, areas, or spaces covered by the meter/account.
Tenant Data System (TDS) number; unique NYCHA development identifier used across datasets.
NYCHA Electronic Data Processing (EDP) number used to identify developments in legacy energy-management systems.
NYCHA budget responsibility code representing a specific development or cost center.
Funding source classification indicating how the facility is financed or categorized.
Asset Management Project (AMP) number, a HUD asset-tracking identifier that may represent one or more developments.
Name of the utility vendor providing electricity service.
Internal Unique Metering or Utility Management Information System bill identifier used by NYCHA to track individual bills.
Year and month of the bill; typically stored as the first day of the billing month for convenience.
First date of the billing period covered by the bill.
Last date of the billing period covered by the bill.
Number of days included in the billing period between service start and end dates.
Utility meter identifier assigned by the vendor; uniquely identifies the physical meter.
Flag indicating whether the bill is based on estimated usage (Y) or actual meter reads (N).
Total dollar charges for the billing period, including energy and applicable fees.
Rate class or tariff code applied to the account according to the vendor’s pricing schedule.
Indicator of whether NYCHA’s Utility Management system reviewed the bill for billing errors during the period.
Total electricity consumed during the billing period, measured in kilowatt-hours (kWh).
Dollar charges associated specifically with kWh energy consumption (excluding demand and other non-energy charges where separated).
Peak or demand consumption during the billing period, measured in kilowatts (kW), typically used for demand billing.
Dollar charges related to kW demand components of the bill.
Total of all other miscellaneous charges (fees, adjustments, taxes, surcharges) not captured in kWh or kW charges.
